unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Defective Light Bulbs
question_text:
A researcher was hired to examine a company's production of defective light bulbs. The bulbs were made in two wattages, $60$ and $100$. Fifty $60$-watt bulbs were randomly selected and $70$ $100$-watt bulbs were randomly selected. Eight defective bulbs were found in the $60$-watt type and $11$ defective bulbs were found in the $100$-watt type. While the company wanted to lower the defective rate overall, it was particularly concerned with keeping the defective rate the same for both bulb types.
Which procedure below would most effectively give this information?

choices.text: Keep taking samples until the defective rates match.
Find a confidence interval for a proportion.
Find a confidence interval for the difference of two proportions.
Find a confidence interval for a mean.
Find a confidence interval for the difference of two means.
